textContent: I can't help but wonder how much of this is because we are centering ourselves in the decision and aren't centering on something greater than ourselves. Ie God or a bigger purpose. Our secular culture has removed anything above the individual. And when taken to the conclusion that the individual Is all that is there, it means there's no room for differences like this. Relationships are based on helping each other achieve each other higher selves, not based on two individuals United through God's love But if our relationship wasn't based on an aspiration for what my life is or your life is and we had faith that it was bigger than us, how would that change when it actually means, to be married? All the b******* mumbo jumbo that religion uses to hold people in fear?
